meanings.definition: Small protein-like molecules used by neurons to communicate with each other.
meanings.sent1: Neuropeptides help neurons send messages to each other.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the role of neuropeptides in brain function.
meanings.sent3: The neuropeptides in the brain had a party and danced all night long.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like neuropeptides, transmitting thoughts effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The classroom buzzed with excitement, like a network of neuropeptides firing signals.

meanings.definition: A type of signaling molecule found in the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: Neuropeptides act as messengers in the nervous system.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the function of neuropeptides in the brain.
meanings.sent3: The neuropeptides in the brain whispered secrets to each other.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a neuropeptide, spreading happiness wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The neuropeptides in the brain were like tiny couriers delivering important news.

meanings.definition: Chemical messengers that play a role in regulating various bodily functions.
meanings.sent1: Neuropeptides help regulate different functions in the body.
meanings.sent2: Athletes need proper levels of neuropeptides for peak performance.
meanings.sent3: The neuropeptides in the body threw a party to celebrate their work.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter spread through the room like neuropeptides, affecting everyone.
meanings.sent5: The neuropeptides in the body were like conductors orchestrating a symphony of functions.
